definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: We'd better put everything in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 我们最好把一切都白纸黑字写下来。

sentences.english: These terms are clearly written in black and white. You can never deny them.
sentences.chinese: 这些条件白纸黑字，一清二楚，想抵赖是抵赖不掉的。

sentences.english: There, on page 2, in black and white, was the bad news.
sentences.chinese: 就在那儿，第二页，白纸黑字，写的是个坏消息。

sentences.english: I'll put everything black and white !
sentences.chinese: 我会把所有事情白纸黑字写清楚。

sentences.english: I'll put everything in black and white!
sentences.chinese: 我会把所有事变白纸黑字写清楚。

sentences.english: eg：1)They demanded that the agreement be written in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求将这份协议用白纸黑字写下来。

sentences.english: They demanded that the agreement be written in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求将这份协议用白纸黑字写下来。

sentences.english: He insisted on putting the agreement down in black and white .
sentences.chinese: 他坚持要把这项协议用白纸黑字写下来。

sentences.english: Other laws, black on white, obtain.
sentences.chinese: 另有法令，白纸黑字，统领此地。

sentences.english: Take a look at your budget in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 用白纸黑字写出您的预算计划。

sentences.english: They just put it in black and white terms.
What you said is down here in black and white .
sentences.chinese: 你说的话已成为白纸黑字，记在这里呢？

sentences.english: Virtually no one suggested in print that unification had been a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 实际上没有人白纸黑字地表明，统一是一件坏事。

sentences.english: It clearly stated that the state of California would not be able to recognize any marriage unions between same-sex parties.
sentences.chinese: 它白纸黑字地规定加州不再承认任何同性结合为婚姻。

sentences.english: Now, you may not think that implied consent is as good as the real thing.
sentences.chinese: 不过你可能认为默认的同意不如白纸黑字的协议。

sentences.english: He insisted on putting the agreement down in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持要把这项协议用白纸黑字写下来。

definition: mere verbal statement cannot be taken as proof (idiom)
(idiom) you can't rely on a verbal agreement/just because sb says sth, doesn't mean it's true
